definitions: To attach a tag or label to.
To follow closely behind someone or something.
To touch someone in a game of tag.
To hit or strike something, often lightly.
To add something, especially an ending or a comment.
examples: She will tag the luggage before boarding.
The younger brother always tags along with his sister.
He managed to tag the ball for a single.
Don't forget to tag your friends in the photo.
